Project.Brief history of your project and organi: The European Space Astronomy Centre Science Data Centre (ESDC) is a hub for accessing and analyzing scientific data produced by ESA’s space science missions. It provides long-term data preservation, public access to mission archives, and tools for exploration and analysis.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File:
•	Open Access to data from major ESA missions including:
	•	Gaia (astrometry and stellar catalog)
	•	XMM-Newton (X-ray astronomy)
	•	Herschel (infrared observations)
	•	INTEGRAL (gamma-ray astronomy)
	•	Planck (cosmic microwave background)
	•	Solar Orbiter (solar physics)
	•	Searchable Archives: Users can query mission-specific databases using custom filters, coordinates, or object names.
	•	Downloadable Datasets: Data are available in formats like FITS, CSV, and VOTable, suitable for scientific analysis.
	•	Visualization and Analysis Tools: The portal includes interactive charts, sky maps, and API access for automated workflows.
Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset: I will first download the dataset and classify the content into different categories. Each data type will be assigned a unique label and stored accordingly. The data will then be segmented, compressed, and packaged using the official built-in tools provided by Lotus (Filecoin’s reference implementation).
